subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 285
msgSnippet: ... No, it s not that.  If JBuilder s compiler flipped the static bit on a method as would be necessary for this problem to occur, then there would be horrible
messageBody:
> Apparently, JBuilder uses its own internal JDK which is not 100%
> the same as the standard.

No, it's not that. If JBuilder's compiler flipped the static bit on a
method as would be necessary for this problem to occur, then there would
be horrible problems.

>> When I compile a junit test file thru' VisualCafe4.0, it gets compiled
>> without any error. Later while invoking the TestRunner utility from
>> console (any approach textui, awtui or swingui), I am getting following
>> error message:
>>
>> java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: junit.framework.Assert: method
>> assert(Ljava/lang/String;Z)V did not used to be static
>>
>> at junit.samples.SimpleTest.testAdd(SimpleTest.java:32)
>>
>> But surprisingly if I compile the same file from console and run the
>> TestRunner utility then test passes without any error and it show a
>> green bar. Perfect run.

This looks to me like the JUnit code you are using in Cafe is not the same
JUnit code you are accessing from the console. The code in Cafe is being
compiled against an Assert class with a static assert() method whereas the
Assert class found in the console environment has a non-static assert
method.

-Steve :)
